 SmsContext (MessageTypeIndicator::Type mt=MessageTypeIndicator::InvalidType)
 ~SmsContext ()

Detailed Description

The class SmsContext represents the sending/storing context of a mobile originated Sms.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

void SmsContext::SetCommandParameter (  const PhoneNumber &  service_center_address,
const PhoneNumber &  destination_address,
const ProtocolIdentifier &  protocol_identifier,
SmsReferenceNumber  message_number,
const CommandType &  command_type,
BOOLEAN  status_report_request
) 
 

Set context parameters with all SMS command relevant parameter manually and updates the MessageType to SMS command type. All SMS command irrelevant data is cleared.

void SmsContext::SetCommandType (  const CommandType &  ct  )  [inline]
 

TP-CT: TP-Command-Type (3GPP 23.040 V5.1.0 [9.2.3.19]) - SMS command type only.

void SmsContext::SetConcatenatedReferenceNoType (  InformationElement::Identifier  conc_refno_type  ) 
 

Interface to change the type of reference number in case of concatenation. Only the values InformationElement::ConcatenatedSm16Bit and InformationElement::ConcatenatedSm8Bit are of use. Default setting is InformationElement::ConcatenatedSm16Bit!

void SmsContext::SetDataCodingScheme (  const DataCodingScheme &  dcs  )  [inline]
 

TP-DCS: TP-Data-Coding-Scheme (3GPP 23.040 V5.1.0 [9.2.3.10]) - SMS submit type only.

void SmsContext::SetDestinationAddress (  const PhoneNumber &  da  ) 
 

TP-DA: TP-Destination-Address (3GPP 23.040 V5.1.0 [9.2.3.8]).

void SmsContext::SetDestinationApplicationPortAddress (  SmsPortNo  destination_port_no  )  [inline]
 

If an Application Port Address (destination) is set (!= to InvalidPortNo), all the SMS sent with this context, will have the port address applied (as part of the UDH). Default value is InvalidPortNo. (3GPP 23.040 V5.1.0 [9.2.3.24.3] resp. 3GPP 23.040 V5.1.0 [9.2.3.24.4])

void SmsContext::SetOriginatorApplicationPortAddress (  SmsPortNo  originator_port_no  )  [inline]
 

If an Application Port Address (originator) is set (!= to InvalidPortNo), all the SMS sent with this context, will have the port address applied (as part of the UDH). Default value is InvalidPortNo. (3GPP 23.040 V5.1.0 [9.2.3.24.3] resp. 3GPP 23.040 V5.1.0 [9.2.3.24.4])
